title: (x) FESTAC '77 poster - (similar to) BD Apotheke {Dav}
content:
Hello,

I am trying to identify the headline font used on the attached vintage FESTAC poster from 1977.

Any help is greatly appreciated.

-=Bookie

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [festac.jpg](http://web.archive.org/system/files?file=festac.jpg) | 21.57 KB |
author: ilikebigbutts2

comments.content:
That’s fascinating. Though it could be an old photo font, I’d bet on a custom drawn logo.

I love that your name is ilikebigbutts2 as if there was already a user named ilikebigbutts.
Maybe the 2 means too, as in ilikebigbuttstoo which might suggest that there was already a user named, say, ilikebigtits.

It has a similar feel to Phill Grimshaw’s lowercase for [Banco](http://web.archive.org/web/20051111165835/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&startrow=1&records=20&currpage=1&totalrecords=11&searchby=&searchID=&searchletter=&searchstr=banco&font_categories_checkbox=font_name_search&fontRendererText=festac%2777)

But it’s not the same.

And I haven’t got the hang of these URLs yet!

EDIT: I might have!

‘ [Apotheke](http://web.archive.org/web/20051111165835/http:/www.typedifferent.com/2002/index.html)’, _by [Buro Destruct](http://web.archive.org/web/20051111165835/http:/www.burodestruct.net/), may be an alternate, as well_..

Thanks,

The BD Apotheke will do the trick.

-Bookie
